intro: Ruellia otaviensis, commonly known as the Mexican bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a rough texture. Ruellia otaviensis thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
